learning we often talk about a policy which is a mapping of past interactions to the next activity and all
a lot of our goals and reinforcement learning can be viewed as how do we construct some way that our agent should make decisions to maximize reward so it
should be a strategy for saying depending on how the student has done so far what is the next mass exercise to do
so that over time we're gonna optimize our reward and it turns out that this
comes up not just in education but in many different other types of domains so we're also thinking about healthcare
examples in this situation from a similar modeling framework and in these cases you could think of let's give some

interacting with a person and trying to optimize something through a series of interactions with that person now in

then we get some observation back and then we have a reward signal so we can have this generic framework for thinking

it's often fairly cheap to try things out so I can have my agent fail to you

try things or it's pretty easy to simulate so we don't have perfect models at the physics of the world but we can do pretty pretty well so we can in these

reasoning is really a core aspect of what it means to be human we can imagine things that we haven't observed and so
